required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Stereotactic Aspiration for Primary Brainstem Hemorrhage Based on 'Zhe-er Classification'
clinical_study.official_title: A Descriptive Research on the Effect of Primary Brainstem Hemorrhage Stereotactic Aspiration Based on 'Zhe-er Classification'

lead_sponsor.agency: Second Affiliated Hospital, School of Medicine, Zhejiang University

clinical_study.source: Second Affiliated Hospital, School of Medicine, Zhejiang University

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine the benefit of stereotaxic aspiration for patients with primary brainstem hemorrhage with the guidance of 'Zhe-er Classification'

detailed_description.textblock: This is a retrospective study aiming to analyze the clinical record of patients from March 2014 to October 2020. This study is indicated for primary brainstem hemorrhage.

primary_outcome.description: Survival events include death, deterioration/recovery of nervous function

arm_group.description: No new/additional patients will be enrolled within this project. Only retrospective data will be collected on survival time and life quality
No new/additional patients will be enrolled within this project. Only retrospective data will be collected on survival time and life quality

intervention.description: No new/additional patients will be enrolled within this project.

study_pop.textblock: All patients with primary brainstem hemorrhage who receive stereotaxic aspiration or conservative therapy from 3/2014 to 10/2020 in 2nd Affiliated Hospital, School of Medicine, Zhejiang University, China

criteria.textblock:
no new patients will be enrolled within this project
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients undergoing a stereotaxic aspiration or conservative therapy from 3/2014 to 10/2020 in 2nd Affiliated Hospital, School of Medicine, Zhejiang University, China
Exclusion Criteria:
- patients with secondary brainstem hemorrhage due to blood vessel malformation, trauma, or malignancies

overall_official.affiliation: 2nd Affiliated Hospital, School of Medicine, Zhejiang University, China
